medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with recurrent mild epigastric pain over the last year, along with decreased appetite and mild bloating after PO intake. Over the last 2 months, the patient experienced 10lbs of unintentional weight loss and recurrent nonbloody diarrhea, especially after fatty meals. On the day of admission, the pain started after taking medication on an empty stomach, accompanied by nausea, dizziness, and weakness. The pain was described as grinding and severe.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Myasthenia gravis, hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), anemia, osteoporosis, stable lung nodules and plaques, benign colonic adenomas, chronic low back pain, depression, and insomnia.
medical_history.family_history: Father had suspected kidney cancer; maternal grandmother had a stroke; no known gynecological, breast, prostate, colon, or pancreatic cancers.
